newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU formally confirms EMU target date '99, not '97.
newsitem.headline: EU formally confirms EMU target date '99, not '97.

text.p: European Union finance ministers formally agreed on Monday what everyone has known for a long time -- that the single currency will not start next year.
The ministers said a majority of countries had failed to meet the Maastricht Treaty criteria for a single currency based on their 1996 economic performance.
Under the treaty, 1997 was set as the launch date for the currency if a majority of EU states was ready. Otherwise, the currency would begin in 1999, the date countries are now aiming for.

Earlier this year, the finance ministers tried to avoid making a formal declaration on which countries qualified because of concerns that the procedure would be misunderstood by financial markets and perhaps contribute to instability.
But strong pressure from the European Parliament prompted a change of heart and Monday's decision.
